trans-unit.source: Hosts a portable, high fidelity, fixed-format document with read access for user text selection, keyboard navigation, and search.
FixedDocument logically binds an ordered sequence of pages together into a single, multi-page, fixed-layout document.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent> is the only allowable child element of the FixedDocument element.
Each <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent> element refers to the source of the content for a single page.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent> elements must be in sequential markup order, matching the page order of the document.

FixedDocument is designed for [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_wys](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-wys-md.md)] applications where the document layout is defined and controlled by the application for rendering to the highest accuracy of the display or print device.

<xref:System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument>, on the other hand, is designed to maximize user readability, and dynamically adjusts the document layout based on user preferences (for example, a user-chosen type size or font) and other variables, such as display size and resolution.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument"></xref> class.
Gets the paginator for the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument"></xref> that provides page-oriented services such as getting a particular page and repaginating in response to changes.

If you need a paginator with automatic repagination in responses to changes, such as adding content to the document, derive a class from <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DynamicDocumentPaginator> which itself inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator>.
An object of a class derived from <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator"></xref> that provides pagination services.
Gets an enumerator for accessing the document's <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.PageContent"></xref> child elements.
An enumerator for accessing the document's <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.PageContent"></xref> child elements.
Creates an automation peer for the document.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DocumentAutomationPeer"></xref> that exposes the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument"></xref> to Microsoft UI Automation.
Gets a collection of the document's <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.PageContent"></xref> elements.
A collection of the document's <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.PageContent"></xref> elements.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that is associated with this document.
A <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> contains printing information such as whether to print on both sides of each sheet.
Setting this PrintTicket property does not validate or modify the specified <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If needed, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>-specific <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is valid for a given printer.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> for this document.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument.PrintTicket*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets the service object of the specified type.
An object that specifies the type of service object to get.
A service object of type serviceType.
-or- if there is no service object of type serviceType.
Adds a child object.
The child object to add.
Adds the text content of a node to the object.
The text to add to the object.
Gets or sets the base URI of the current application context.
The base URI of the application context.
